p: In conclusion, the methanol extract of V. calvum flowers has proven to be a rich source of phenolic compounds and iridoid glycosides. The high anti-radical activity of the extract as well as the anti-inflammatory properties reported in the literature for aucubin ( 43), that is one of the main components, validated the use of V. calvum in the traditional medicine of Kurdistan as an herbal anti-inflammatory remedy and for topical application to treat skin wounds and burns.
